verses.verse: I saw in the right hand of him who sat on the throne a book written on the inside and out and sealed with seven seals on the outside.
I also saw a strong angel announcing with a loud voice, "Who is worthy to open this book and to break its seals?"
No one in heaven, on earth, or under the earth could open the book much less look on it.
And I kept on sobbing, because no one was found worthy to open or read the book, nor even to look on it.
One of the elders says to me, "Stop sobbing. Look, The Lion of the tribe of Judah, the root of David, has won the victory to open the book and loosen its seals."

So I looked and, lo, standing in the center of the throne, the four living creatures, and the elders [was] a Lamb, who appeared to have been violently killed. [This lamb] had seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God sent out into the entire world.
He came and took the book out of the right hand of the one sitting on the throne.

When he had taken the book, the four living creatures [and] twenty-four elders dropped down in front of the Lamb. Each had a harp and a gold, shallow cup full of incense, which are the prayers of God's people.

They sang a new song, singing, "You are worthy to take the book and break its seals, because you were violently killed and have redeemed us to God by your blood out of every tribe, language, race, and nation.
"You have made us kings and priests to serve our God, and we will reign on the earth."
Then I looked and heard the voice of many angels around the throne, the living creatures, and the elders. The number of them was ten thousand times ten thousand and thousands of thousands,
saying with loud voices, "Worthy is the Lamb who was violently killed, to receive power, riches, wisdom, strength, honor, glory, and blessings."

Next I heard every creature in heaven, in earth, under the earth, and those on the sea, everyone, singing, "Blessing, honor, glory, and power be him who sits on the throne and to the Lamb forever and ever."
The four living creatures said, "Amen." The twenty-four elders dropped down and worshipped him who lives forever and ever.
